Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 17:35 - We can now confirm that all power in the High Road, N22 8 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault which our engineers have repaired.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We're very sorry that you've lost power today. This was an unplanned outage and we did not know this was going to happen. For this reason, we were unable to provide you with advanced notice; we can only notify customers from when we are made aware of the power cut. Just so you know, when we are made aware of a fault, we proactively text our customers to let them know. If you were not proactively contacted today and would like to be in the future, please visit https://bit.ly/3APHPTJ to register for free. Currently the team have completed the excavations and they are working on the repairs. The estimated time frame to have the power back on is still between 1800 - 1900.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
With darkness now approaching we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Lee at 16:14.

Steps.Message:
Our staff are on site in the N22 5, N22 8 area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 1730 - 1830; this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Lee at 14:24.

Logs.Comment:
Our staff are on site in the N22 5, N22 8 area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 1730 - 1830; this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Lee at 14:24.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 17:38 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Hadham Road,CM23 2 area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power went gone off again today.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Lee at 17:34
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lee at 17:31 -We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 18:30 - We can now confirm that all power in the Glenelg Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 17:47 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Glenelg Road area, the estimated time of 19:30 and 20:30 hasn't changed. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Lee at 14:57 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hadley Highstone area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected 3rd party damaging a section of cables, which our engineers have now repaired.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Lee at 14:23 -We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu
 
If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Hello. Lee, Luke and Aaron have now taken over, so we'll be here to pass on news from our field staff while works continue to get your lights back on.

Our engineers are still on site working on the repairs to the underground cable fault and the estimated time frame to have the power back on hasn't changed.

We hope you're still holding up without power, we know it can be worrying but as soon as we have some more news we'll send you another message.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Sent by Luke at 16:31 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1719 customers in the New Malden, KT3 3/4 area, by diverting power around the underground fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 16:15 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that they need more resources to assist with repairs. To allow time for these to arrive and for the work to be completed safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 20:00 and 21:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the New Malden, KT3 3/4 area to investigate the power cut affecting 270 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Luke at 15:53.

Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today. Our staff have confirmed they have diverted the power around a overhead network fault and managed to restore power to the CM1 4, CM6 3, CM3 1 area by approximately 17:26.

We apologise that this final update is delayed. After restoring supplies, our engineers first need to carry out essential safety tests before they are able to call us to confirm that everyone has been restored.

We're sorry for any disruption caused by this unexpected power cut, but if your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles. Sent by Lee at 17:41.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Lee from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers are working to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the CM1 4, CM6 3, CM3 1 area to investigate the power cut affecting 341 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Lee at 17:26.

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Stephanie and I am the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks in Ipswich. Today's power cut was unexpected, so we were unable to provide you with prior notice to help you plan ahead. I am pleased to confirm that we managed to resolve this by diverting power to get your lights back on as soon as possible. Just so you know, we text customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in the future you can do so here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L. This was a widespread problem on the underground network and I personally apologise for any disruption this has caused to your day. If you have any questions or are still without power, please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  Our engineers have attended the fault, and have made an emergency repair to restore power to as many premises as possible.  It is our intention to return to make a permanent repair as soon as we can.  I'm sorry, but we can't give you a time for this at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 12:52 - We can now confirm that all but one property in the KT16 9, GU21 4 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around the underground cable fault to get the majority of customers back on. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used temporary generators to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused and the length of time you've been affected. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 12:48 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that further equipment is needed to connect the remaining 15:00 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Talie at 12:28 - Our staff have connected another generator, so a further two homes and businesses now have their lights safely back on. We know there's still 58 properties affected by the power cut, and if your power is still off, don't worry - we'll continue to send you updates from our staff. We may send a few texts like this, so if your power has come back on now, or does at any point later on, just follow this link to stop our SMS updates https://bit.ly/348KOZ3.
